intro: Heligme minahassae, commonly known as the Minahassa heligme, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to habitat loss, Heligme minahassae is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
